Notes.Text:
This update for keylime fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2025-13609: avoid re-registration of clients with same UUID but with different TPM identity (bsc#1254199).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: A vulnerability has been identified in keylime where an attacker can exploit this flaw by registering a new agent using a different Trusted Platform Module (TPM) device but claiming an existing agent's unique identifier (UUID). This action overwrites the legitimate agent's identity, enabling the attacker to impersonate the compromised agent and potentially bypass security controls.
